org.tribler.tsap

Class NavigationDrawerFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • org.tribler.tsap.NavigationDrawerFragment

  • public class NavigationDrawerFragment
extends Fragment
    Fragment used for managing interactions for and presentation of a navigation drawer. See the design guidelines for a complete explanation of the behaviors implemented here.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  NavigationDrawerFragment.NavigationDrawerCallbacks
      Callbacks interface that all activities using this fragment must implement.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private NavigationDrawerFragment.NavigationDrawerCallbacks mCallbacks
      A pointer to the current callbacks instance (the Activity).
      private int mCurrentLoadedFragmentPosition 
      private int mCurrentSelectedPosition 
      private android.support.v4.widget.DrawerLayout mDrawerLayout 
      private ListView mDrawerListView 
      private android.support.v4.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle mDrawerToggle
      Helper component that ties the action bar to the navigation drawer.
      private View mFragmentContainerView 
      private boolean mFromSavedInstanceState 
      private boolean mUserLearnedDrawer 
      private static java.lang.String PREF_USER_LEARNED_DRAWER
      Per the design guidelines, you should show the drawer on launch until the user manually expands it.
      private static java.lang.String STATE_SELECTED_POSITION
      Remember the position of the selected item.

      private ActionBar getActionBar()
      Returns the activity's action bar

      Returns a new ActionBarDrawerToggle that ties together the the proper interactions between the navigation drawer and the action bar app icon

      Indicates whether the navigation drawer is open or not

      Forwards the new configuration to the drawer toggle component

      Read the flag of the saved instance indicating whether the user has learned the navigation drawer and selects an item

      Users of this fragment must call this method to set up the navigation drawer interactions.
      private void showGlobalContextActionBar()
      Per the navigation drawer design guidelines, updates the action bar to show the global app 'context', rather than just what's in the current screen.

    • Field Detail

      • STATE_SELECTED_POSITION

        private static final java.lang.String STATE_SELECTED_POSITION
        Remember the position of the selected item.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PREF_USER_LEARNED_DRAWER

        private static final java.lang.String PREF_USER_LEARNED_DRAWER
        Per the design guidelines, you should show the drawer on launch until the user manually expands it. This shared preference tracks this.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Read the flag of the saved instance indicating whether the user has learned the navigation drawer and selects an item
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - The saved instance state containing the flag

      • onActivityCreated

        public void onActivityCreated(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Indicates that this fragment would like to influence the set of actions in the action bar.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - The state of the saved instance

      • onCreateView

        public View onCreateView(LayoutInflater inflater,
                         ViewGroup container,
                         Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Initializes the navigation drawer's ListView
        Parameters:
        inflater - The inflater used to inflate the navigation drawer layout
        container - The container view of this fragment
        savedInstanceState - The state of the saved instance
        Returns:
        The created view

      • isDrawerOpen

        public boolean isDrawerOpen()
        Indicates whether the navigation drawer is open or not
        Returns:
        True iff the navigation drawer is open

      • setUp

        public void setUp(int fragmentId,
                  android.support.v4.widget.DrawerLayout drawerLayout)
        Users of this fragment must call this method to set up the navigation drawer interactions.
        Parameters:
        fragmentId - The android:id of this fragment in its activity's layout.
        drawerLayout - The DrawerLayout containing this fragment's UI.

      • getActionBarDrawerToggle

        private android.support.v4.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle getActionBarDrawerToggle()
        Returns a new ActionBarDrawerToggle that ties together the the proper interactions between the navigation drawer and the action bar app icon
        Returns:
        A new ActionBarDrawerToggle instance

      • selectItem

        private void selectItem(int position)
        Selects the navigation drawer item that the user has pressed
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the navigation drawer item to be selected

      • onAttach

        public void onAttach(Activity activity)
        Initializes the callback variable
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity belonging to this fragment

      • onDetach

        public void onDetach()
        Resets the callback variable

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(Bundle outState)
        Saves the selected position of the navigation drawer
        Parameters:
        outState - The bundle in which the selected position is stored

      • onConfigurationChanged

        public void onConfigurationChanged(Configuration newConfig)
        Forwards the new configuration to the drawer toggle component
        Parameters:
        newConfig - The new configuration

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public void onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu,
                                MenuInflater inflater)
        If the drawer is open, show the global app actions in the action bar. See also showGlobalContextActionBar(), which controls the top-left area of the action bar.

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        Defines the behaviour of selecting a menu item
        Parameters:
        item - The menu item that has been clicked
        Returns:
        True iff the menu item's behaviour is executed correctly

      • showGlobalContextActionBar

        private void showGlobalContextActionBar()
        Per the navigation drawer design guidelines, updates the action bar to show the global app 'context', rather than just what's in the current screen.

      • getActionBar

        private ActionBar getActionBar()
        Returns the activity's action bar
        Returns:
        The action bar of the application
